reset_to_fbx_on_material_conflict.name: Reset to Fbx on Material Conflict
reset_to_fbx_on_material_conflict.description: If true, the imported material sections will automatically be reset to the imported data in case of a reimport conflict

build_nanite.name: Build Nanite
build_nanite.description: If enabled, allows to render objects with Nanite

auto_generate_collision.name: Generate Missing Collision
auto_generate_collision.description: If checked, collision will automatically be generated (ignored if custom collision is imported or used)

static_mesh_lod_group.name: Static Mesh LODGroup
static_mesh_lod_group.description: The LODGroup to associate with this mesh when it is imported

vertex_color_import_option.name: Vertex Color Import Option
vertex_color_import_option.description: Specify how vertex colors should be imported
enum_items: Import the static mesh using the vertex colors from the FBX file
Ignore vertex colors from the FBX file, and keep the existing mesh vertex colors
Override all vertex colors with the specified color.

vertex_override_color.name: Vertex Override Color (RGB)
vertex_override_color.description: Specify override color in the case that VertexColorImportOption is set to Override

remove_degenerates.name: Remove Degenerates
remove_degenerates.description: Disabling this option will keep degenerate triangles found. In general you should leave this option on

build_reversed_index_buffer.name: Build Reversed Index Buffer
build_reversed_index_buffer.description: Required to optimize mesh in mirrored transform. Double index buffer size

one_convex_hull_per_ucx.name: One Convex Hull Per UCX
one_convex_hull_per_ucx.description: If checked, one convex hull per UCX_ prefixed collision mesh will be generated instead of decomposing into multiple hulls

combine_meshes.name: Combine Meshes
combine_meshes.description: If enabled, combines all meshes into a single mesh

transform_vertex_to_absolute.name: Transform Vertex to Absolute
transform_vertex_to_absolute.description: If this option is true the node absolute transform (transform, offset and pivot) will be apply to the mesh vertices

bake_pivot_in_vertex.name: Bake Pivot in Vertex
bake_pivot_in_vertex.description: Experimental - If this option is true the inverse node rotation pivot will be apply to the mesh vertices. The pivot from the DCC will then be the origin of the mesh. Note: “TransformVertexToAbsolute” must be false

normal_import_method.name: Normal Import Method
normal_import_method.description: Enabling this option will read the tangents(tangent,binormal,normal) from FBX file instead of generating them automatically

normal_generation_method.name: Normal Generation Method
normal_generation_method.description: Use the MikkTSpace tangent space generator for generating normals and tangents on the mesh
enum_items: Use the legacy built in method to generate normals (faster in some cases)
Use MikkTSpace to generate normals and tangents

compute_weighted_normals.name: Compute Weighted Normals
compute_weighted_normals.description: Enabling this option will use weighted normals algorithm (area and angle) when computing normals or tangents

convert_scene.name: Convert Scene
convert_scene.description: Convert the scene from FBX coordinate system to Unreal Engine coordinate system

force_front_x_axis.name: Force Front X Axis
force_front_x_axis.description: Convert the scene from FBX coordinate system to Unreal Engine coordinate system with front X axis instead of -Y

convert_scene_unit.name: Convert Scene Unit
convert_scene_unit.description: Convert the scene from FBX unit to UE unit (centimeter)

reorder_material_to_fbx_order.name: Reorder Material to FBX Order
reorder_material_to_fbx_order.description: The material list will be reorder to the same order has the FBX file

import_content_type.name: Import Content Type
import_content_type.description: Filter the content we want to import from the incoming skeletal mesh
enum_items: Import all fbx content: geometry, skinning, and weights
Import skeletal mesh geometry only (will create a default skeleton, or map the geometry to the existing one). Morph and LOD can be imported with it
Import the skeletal mesh skinning and weights only. (no geometry will be imported). Morph and LOD will not be imported with this setting

vertex_color_import_option.name: Vertex Color Import Option
vertex_color_import_option.description: Specify how vertex colors should be imported
enum_items: Import the static mesh using the vertex colors from the FBX file
Ignore vertex colors from the FBX file, and keep the existing mesh vertex colors
Override all vertex colors with the specified color.

vertex_override_color.name: Vertex Override Color (RGB)
vertex_override_color.description: Specify override color in the case that VertexColorImportOption is set to Override

update_skeleton_reference_pose.name: Update Skeleton Reference Pose
update_skeleton_reference_pose.description: If enabled, update the Skeleton (of the mesh being imported)’s reference pose

import_morph_targets.name: Import Morph Targets
import_morph_targets.description: If enabled, creates Unreal morph objects for the imported meshes

use_t0_as_ref_pose.name: Use TO As Ref Pose
use_t0_as_ref_pose.description: Enable this option to use frame 0 as reference pose

preserve_smoothing_groups.name: Preserve Smoothing Groups
preserve_smoothing_groups.description: If checked, triangles with non-matching smoothing groups will be physically split

import_meshes_in_bone_hierarchy.name: Import Meshes in Bone Hierarchy
import_meshes_in_bone_hierarchy.description: If checked, meshes nested in bone hierarchies will be imported instead of being converted to bones

transform_vertex_to_absolute.name: Transform Vertex to Absolute
transform_vertex_to_absolute.description: If this option is true the node absolute transform (transform, offset and pivot) will be apply to the mesh vertices

bake_pivot_in_vertex.name: Bake Pivot in Vertex
bake_pivot_in_vertex.description: Experimental - If this option is true the inverse node rotation pivot will be apply to the mesh vertices. The pivot from the DCC will then be the origin of the mesh. Note: “TransformVertexToAbsolute” must be false

normal_import_method.name: Normal Import Method
normal_import_method.description: Enabling this option will read the tangents(tangent,binormal,normal) from FBX file instead of generating them automatically

normal_generation_method.name: Normal Generation Method
normal_generation_method.description: Use the MikkTSpace tangent space generator for generating normals and tangents on the mesh
enum_items: Use the legacy built in method to generate normals (faster in some cases)
Use MikkTSpace to generate normals and tangents

compute_weighted_normals.name: Compute Weighted Normals
compute_weighted_normals.description: Enabling this option will use weighted normals algorithm (area and angle) when computing normals or tangents

threshold_position.name: Threshold Position
threshold_position.description: Threshold to compare vertex position equality

threshold_tangent_normal.name: Threshold Tangent Normal
threshold_tangent_normal.description: Threshold to compare normal, tangent or bi-normal equality

morph_threshold_position.name: Morph Threshold Position
morph_threshold_position.description: Threshold to compare vertex position equality when computing morph target deltas

convert_scene.name: Convert Scene
convert_scene.description: Convert the scene from FBX coordinate system to Unreal Engine coordinate system

force_front_x_axis.name: Force Front X Axis
force_front_x_axis.description: Convert the scene from FBX coordinate system to Unreal Engine coordinate system with front X axis instead of -Y

convert_scene_unit.name: Convert Scene Unit
convert_scene_unit.description: Convert the scene from FBX unit to UE unit (centimeter)

reorder_material_to_fbx_order.name: Reorder Material to FBX Order
reorder_material_to_fbx_order.description: The material list will be reorder to the same order has the FBX file

animation_length.name: Animation Length
animation_length.description: Which animation range to import. The one defined at Exported, at Animated time or define a range manually
enum_items: This option imports animation frames based on what is defined at the time of export
Will import the range of frames that have animation. Can be useful if the exported range is longer than the actual animation in the FBX file
This will enable the Start Frame and End Frame properties for you to define the frames of animation to import

frame_import_range.name: Frame Import Range
frame_import_range.description: Frame range used when Set Range is used in Animation Length

import_meshes_in_bone_hierarchy.name: Import Meshes in Bone Hierarchy
import_meshes_in_bone_hierarchy.description: If checked, meshes nested in bone hierarchies will be imported instead of being converted to bones

use_default_sample_rate.name: Use Default Sample Rate
use_default_sample_rate.description: If enabled, samples all animation curves to 30 FPS

custom_sample_rate.name: Custom Sample Rate
custom_sample_rate.description: Sample fbx animation data at the specified sample rate, 0 find automatically the best sample rate

import_custom_attribute.name: Import Custom Attribute
import_custom_attribute.description: Import if custom attribute as a curve within the animation

delete_existing_custom_attribute_curves.name: Delete Existing Custom Attribute Curves
delete_existing_custom_attribute_curves.description: If true, all previous custom attribute curves will be deleted when doing a re-import

import_bone_tracks.name: Import Bone Tracks
import_bone_tracks.description: Import bone transform tracks. If false, this will discard any bone transform tracks. (useful for curves only animations)

set_material_drive_parameter_on_custom_a.name: Set Material Curve Type
set_material_drive_parameter_on_custom_a.description: Set Material Curve Type for all custom attributes that exists

material_curve_suffixes.name: Material Curve Suffixes
material_curve_suffixes.description: Set Material Curve Type for the custom attribute with the following suffixes. This doesn’t matter if Set Material Curve Type is true. This is a comma separated list of names

remove_redundant_keys.name: Remove Redundant Keys
remove_redundant_keys.description: When importing custom attribute as curve, remove redundant keys

delete_existing_morph_target_curves.name: Delete Existing Morph Target Curves
delete_existing_morph_target_curves.description: If enabled, this will delete this type of asset from the FBX

do_not_import_curve_with_zero.name: Do not import curves with only 0 values
do_not_import_curve_with_zero.description: When importing custom attribute or morphtarget as curve, do not import if it does not have any value other than zero. This is to avoid adding extra curves to evaluate

preserve_local_transform.name: Preserve Local Transform
preserve_local_transform.description: If enabled, this will import a curve within the animation

convert_scene.name: Convert Scene
convert_scene.description: Convert the scene from FBX coordinate system to Unreal Engine coordinate system

force_front_x_axis.name: Force Front X Axis
force_front_x_axis.description: Convert the scene from FBX coordinate system to Unreal Engine coordinate system with front X axis instead of -Y

convert_scene_unit.name: Convert Scene Unit
convert_scene_unit.description: Convert the scene from FBX unit to UE unit (centimeter)

material_search_location.name: Material Import Method
material_search_location.description: Specify where we should search for matching materials when importing
enum_items: Search for matching material in local import folder only
Search for matching material recursively from parent folder
Search for matching material recursively from root folder
Search for matching material in all assets folders
Do not search for existing matching materials

base_material_name.name: Base Material Name
base_material_name.description: Base material to instance from when importing materials

invert_normal_maps.name: Invert Normal Maps
invert_normal_maps.description: If importing textures is enabled, this option will cause normal map Y (Green) values to be inverted

convert_scene.name: Convert Scene
convert_scene.description: Convert the scene from FBX coordinate system to Unreal Engine coordinate system

force_front_x_axis.name: Force Front X Axis
force_front_x_axis.description: Convert the scene from FBX coordinate system to Unreal Engine coordinate system with front X axis instead of -Y

convert_scene_unit.name: Convert Scene Unit
convert_scene_unit.description: Convert the scene from FBX unit to UE unit (centimeter)

rotation.name: Rotation
rotation.description: Rotation in Euler angles in degrees to fix up or front axes

scale.name: Scale
scale.description: Scale value to convert file unit into centimeters

recompute_normals.name: Recompute Normals
recompute_normals.description: If true, normals in the raw mesh are ignored and recomputed

recompute_tangents.name: Recompute Tangents
recompute_tangents.description: If true, tangents in the raw mesh are ignored and recomputed

use_mikk_t_space.name: Use Mikk T Space
use_mikk_t_space.description: A common standard for tangent space used in baking tools to produce normal maps

compute_weighted_normals.name: Compute Weighted Normals
compute_weighted_normals.description: If true, we will use the surface area and the corner angle of the triangle as a ratio when computing the normals

remove_degenerates.name: Remove Degenerates
remove_degenerates.description: If true, degenerate triangles will be removed

build_reversed_index_buffer.name: Build Reversed Index Buffer
build_reversed_index_buffer.description: Required to optimize mesh in mirrored transform. Double index buffer size

use_high_precision_tangent_basis.name: Use High Precision Tangent Basis
use_high_precision_tangent_basis.description: If true, Tangents will be stored at 16 bit vs 8 bit precision

use_full_precision_u_vs.name: Use Full Precision UVs
use_full_precision_u_vs.description: If true, UVs will be stored at full floating point precision

build_scale3d.name: Build Scale
build_scale3d.description: The local scale applied when building the mesh

generate_distance_field_as_if_two_sided.name: Two-Sided Distance Field Generation
generate_distance_field_as_if_two_sided.description: Whether to generate the distance field treating every triangle hit as a front face. When enabled prevents the distance field from being discarded due to the mesh being open, but also lowers Distance Field AO quality

recompute_normals.name: Recompute Normals
recompute_normals.description: If true, normals in the raw mesh are ignored and recomputed

recompute_tangents.name: Recompute Tangents
recompute_tangents.description: If true, tangents in the raw mesh are ignored and recomputed

use_mikk_t_space.name: Use Mikk T Space
use_mikk_t_space.description: A common standard for tangent space used in baking tools to produce normal maps

compute_weighted_normals.name: Compute Weighted Normals
compute_weighted_normals.description: If true, we will use the surface area and the corner angle of the triangle as a ratio when computing the normals

remove_degenerates.name: Remove Degenerates
remove_degenerates.description: If true, degenerate triangles will be removed

use_high_precision_tangent_basis.name: Use High Precision Tangent Basis
use_high_precision_tangent_basis.description: If true, Tangents will be stored at 16 bit vs 8 bit precision

use_full_precision_u_vs.name: Use Full Precision UVs
use_full_precision_u_vs.description: If true, UVs will be stored at full floating point precision

threshold_position.name: Threshold Position
threshold_position.description: Threshold to compare vertex position equality

threshold_tangent_normal.name: Threshold Tangent Normal
threshold_tangent_normal.description: Threshold to compare normal, tangent or bi-normal equality

morph_threshold_position.name: Morph Threshold Position
morph_threshold_position.description: Threshold to compare vertex position equality when computing morph target deltas

global_scale.name: Scale
global_scale.description: Scale all data (Some importers do not support scaled armatures!)

apply_scale_options.name: Apply Scalings
apply_scale_options.description: How to apply custom and units scalings in generated FBX file (Blender uses FBX scale to detect units on import, but many other applications do not handle the same way)
enum_items: Apply custom scaling and units scaling to each object transformation, FBX scale remains at 1.0
Apply custom scaling to each object transformation, and units scaling to FBX scale
Apply custom scaling to FBX scale, and units scaling to each object transformation
Apply custom scaling and units scaling to FBX scale

apply_unit_scale.name: Apply Unit
apply_unit_scale.description: Take into account current Blender units settings (if unset, raw Blender Units values are used as-is)

bake_space_transform.name: !EXPERIMENTAL! Apply Transform
bake_space_transform.description: Bake space transform into object data, avoids getting unwanted rotations to objects when target space is not aligned with Blender's space (WARNING! experimental option, use at own risks, known broken with armatures/animations)

mesh_smooth_type.name: Smoothing
mesh_smooth_type.description: Export smoothing information (prefer 'Normals Only' option if your target importer understand split normals)
enum_items: Export only normals instead of writing edge or face smoothing data

use_subsurf.name: Export Subdivision Surface
use_subsurf.description: Export the last Catmull-Rom subdivision modifier as FBX subdivision (does not apply the modifier even if 'Apply Modifiers' is enabled)

use_mesh_modifiers.name: Apply Modifiers Viewport
use_mesh_modifiers.description: Apply modifiers in viewport to mesh objects (except Armature ones) - WARNING: prevents exporting shape keys

use_mesh_modifiers_render.name: Apply Modifiers Render
use_mesh_modifiers_render.description: Apply modifiers in render to mesh objects (except Armature ones) - WARNING: prevents exporting shape keys

use_tspace.name: Tangent Space
use_tspace.description: Add binormal and tangent vectors, together with normal they form the tangent space (will only work correctly with tris/quads only meshes!)

armature_nodetype.name: Armature FBXNode Type
armature_nodetype.description: FBX type of node (object) used to represent Blender's armatures (use Null one unless you experience issues with other app, other choices may no import back perfectly in Blender...)
enum_items: 'Null' FBX node, similar to Blender's Empty (default)
'Root' FBX node, supposed to be the root of chains of bones...
'LimbNode' FBX node, a regular joint between two bones...

use_armature_deform_only.name: Only Deform Bones
use_armature_deform_only.description: Only write deforming bones (and non-deforming ones when they have deforming children)

add_leaf_bones.name: Add Leaf Bones
add_leaf_bones.description: Append a final bone to the end of each chain to specify last bone length (use this when you intend to edit the armature from exported data)

bake_anim_use_all_bones.name: Key All Bones
bake_anim_use_all_bones.description: Force exporting at least one key of animation for all bones (needed with some target applications, like Unreal Engine)

bake_anim_force_startend_keying.name: Force Start/End Keying
bake_anim_force_startend_keying.description: Always add a keyframe at start and end of actions for animated channels

bake_anim_step.name: Sampling Rate
bake_anim_step.description: How often to evaluate animated values (in frames)

bake_anim_simplify_factor.name: Simplify
bake_anim_simplify_factor.description: How much to simplify baked values (0.0 to disable, the higher the more simplified)

global_scale.name: Scale
global_scale.description: Value by which to enlarge or shrink the objects with respect to the worlds origin

use_instancing.name: Use Instancing
use_instancing.description: Export data of duplicated objects as Alembic instances; speeds up the export and can be disabled for compatibility with other software
